translation: (1) By the sun and its brightness
(2) And [by] the moon when it follows it
(3) And [by] the day when it displays it[1931]
footnotes: [1931]- The earth. Also interpreted as the sun. The same applies to the following verse.

translation: (4) And [by] the night when it covers [i.e., conceals] it
(5) And [by] the sky and He who constructed it
(6) And [by] the earth and He who spread it
(7) And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it[1932]
footnotes: [1932]- i.e., balanced and refined it, creating in it sound tendencies and consciousness.

translation: (8) And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,
(9) He has succeeded who purifies it,
(10) And he has failed who instills it [with corruption].
(11) Thamūd denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,
(12) When the most wretched of them was sent forth.[1933]
footnotes: [1933]- To hamstring the she-camel which had been sent by Allāh as a sign to them.

arabic_text: فَقَالَ لَهُمۡ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقۡيَٰهَا
translation: (13) And the messenger of Allāh [i.e., Ṣāliḥ] said to them, "[Do not harm] the she-camel of Allāh or [prevent her from] her drink."

arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
translation: (14) But they denied him and hamstrung[1934] her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].
(15) And He does not fear the consequence thereof.[1935]
footnotes: [1935]- Allāh is not asked about what He does, but His servants will be asked. See 21:23.
